intro: Pentagonia tapacula, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its pentagonal-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture with a serrated edge. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, while the fruit is a green, fleshy berry that turns yellow when ripe.
